TextView.android:text:
Chemistry is the advanced synergy for master alchemists. By using special formulas, a chemist can create incredible concoctions that can match powerful magic. Once an alchemist has obtained a rank of Chemistry they can begin to attempt more complicated creations. Chemistry can only be produced through logistics.

		The process of crafting from a formula or blueprint is identical. All formulas and blueprints range in difficulty from 1 to 20. On the formula or blueprint will be the Master Catalysts required, the difficulty level, the required RM types and possibly, although rare, specific items of note. Both formulas and blueprints are considered regular paper and can be easily destroyed, so protect them! 

		Chemistry Formulas have different RM and catalyst requirements based on the difficulty of the formula. A difficulty 1 Formula requires 50RM and 1 Master Catalyst, as specified on the Formula. Each additional level will add +10RM and +1 Master Catalyst. All chemistry will expire 1 year after creation if unused. This expiry cannot be increased during production. Additional catalysts may optionally be used to increase the odds of success.

		The marshal will prepare the bag of stones with 20 white stones. They will add black stones equal to the difficulty of the formula or blueprint and 5 black stones for each missing Master Catalyst, any catalysts used to extend the duration of a blueprint are considered Master Catalysts. They will also add 1 white stone for each catalyst provided in excess of the required Master Catalysts.

		The crafter will blindly pull a single stone from the bag. A white stone means the craft was a success. A black stone means the craft has failed.
\t\tNote: These are short descriptions of chemistries commonly known in-game. Additional synergies exist but you must discover them in game!
Strong enough to resist even magical sleep.
Adds a big extra wallop to your weapon.
Like wine but you smoke it!
Protects against all types of acidic damage.
Wave this under someone’s nose and it’ll wake them up or clear their head if they’re confused.
This firework explodes in a large bright flash.
Super sticky sour candy. Good luck speaking after eating one of these.
This makes your weapon silver for a day.
Adds a big wallop to your weapon, three times.
Like alchemical acid, but much stronger.
Makes you really strong, then really weak.
Fae cannot cross this if you pour in on the ground.
Undead cannot cross this if you pour it on the ground.
A bottle of gross smelling fumes that’ll spread quickly.
This will destroy shields and weapons and will also splash the target with acid. Nasty.
Ever want to hose all your enemies down with acid?
This makes you strong AND regenerates your health.
If you drink this, you’ll be mistaken for a corpse.
Restores life to the almost dead.
Makes you immune to webs for a while.
Get more out of your weapon’s contact alchemy.
This will delay alchemy that you’ve already ingested.
A pie that you can cram full of alchemy!
Allows you to speak to spirits. No, for real it works.
When you eat this pickle you’ll heal from booze.
This makes your weapons magical. 10 doses!
Inject this into a corpse and you’ll have a new friend. (Not necromancy I swear)
Extends any chemistry for a year.
Weapons dipped in this bucket will be covered in whatever alchemy you pour in first.
If you mix your blood with someone else’s blood you’ll end up with lots of their blood. But why want this?
Nothing can stop you or hold you down!
This will turn you into a plant monster.
Converts non-alchemical RM into alchemical RM. (!!!)
Turns you into a frenzied, powerful monster.
